bio:treatment.description: Culms 2-16 cm. Panicles 1-3 cm, often reduced to 1 spikelet. Lemmas 6.5-7.5 mm, pubescent or glabrous, margins bluntly angled; awns sometimes divaricate at maturity. Caryopses shorter than the paleas.
bio:treatment.discussion: Bromus hordeaceus subsp. thominei grows along the Pacific coast of Canada, from the Queen Charlotte Islands to Vancouver Island, as well as at inland locations in British Columbia; it has also been recorded from California, Massachusetts, and Rhode Island.
